title: Album Page, "Ceiling of Château de Chenonceau, Chenonceaux", June 17, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (perpendicular to drawing) 52; bottom right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 45; to left of drawing (written on ruled lines): There were four panels / decorated like this one / in center; below drawing: this must be / about 0.70 in checking moulding; to right of drawing: section of rib / ceiling of Chenonceaux / no scale - June 17th 1888.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  The sheet illustrates four panels of a woodwork ceiling in the Château de Chenonceau.  Each panel is framed by a golden yellow molding with the face of the woodwork parallel to the floor colored red.  One panel is further decorated with a single golden yellow ribbon of ornament that doubles upon itself at the corners to create fleur-de-lys of loops.  The artist notes that all the panels bore this decoration.  To the right of this is a section or profile of the molding that frames the panels.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Ceiling of Château de Chenonceau, Chenonceaux", June 17, 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-218.
